channel.title: My website
channel.description:
As some of you already know I bought a domain and a hosting package on a whim while I was under the influence of alcohol.
I didn't know what to do to the website as I was inexperienced with web design so I left it for a few months. Today I found myself with some spare time so I decided to download dreamweaver, as a few people told me it was useful with web design. I did and I've been using it ever since it downloaded.
Anyways the point of this post was to show you guys how far I got. I completely know its shit so far, and I've probably done a lot wrong. So please don't post "OMFG ITS SHIT" you may however post "OMFG ITS SHIT, but if you do ***** then you can improve it"
www.sexydave.co.uk
Also I don't think this counts as advertising as I'm not really gaining anything apart from critosism.
I used photoshop to make the banner, and mixed and matched with the news box. I will be updating it also so of course its very basic at the moment.
One question I have is: How do I make everything in the center of the browser? At the moment its sort of to the left, and there doesn't appear to be an option in dream weaver to center it.
Thanks guys.

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Replace this:

@charset "utf-8";
/* CSS Document */

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body {
	background-color: #000000;
}
.style1 {color: #CCCCCC}
#apDiv1 {
	position:absolute;
	left:229px;
	top:173px;
	width:421px;
	height:215px;
	z-index:1;
	overflow: auto;
}
.style4 {
	color: #FFFFFF;
	font-weight: bold;
}
#apDiv2 {
	position:absolute;
	left:221px;
	top:130px;
	width:126px;
	height:63px;
	z-index:2;
}
.style5 {
	color: #FFFFFF;
	font-family: "Comic Sans MS";
	font-size: 14px;
}

-->
</style>

With this:

@charset "utf-8";
/* CSS Document */

body {
	background-color: #000000;
}
.style1 {color: #CCCCCC}
#apDiv1 {
	position:absolute;
	left:229px;
	top:173px;
	width:421px;
	height:215px;
	z-index:1;
	overflow: auto;
}
.style4 {
	color: #FFFFFF;
	font-weight: bold;
}
#apDiv2 {
	position:absolute;
	left:221px;
	top:130px;
	width:126px;
	height:63px;
	z-index:2;
}
.style5 {
	color: #FFFFFF;
	font-family: "Comic Sans MS";
	font-size: 14px;
}

Might as well explain.
I just took out the HTML tags from the CSS file. They’re not supposed to mix =P

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Ok i transfered all the css over to a seperate file. Not sure that its working. The black background to my website is now missing… and i’m not sure if its worked.

Anyone know?

Also Unhandled: O wow I’m proud i understood what WYSIWYG ment :S

edit - so uhh why does the background not be black? The .css says

body { background-color: #000000; }
But still the background is white. Am i doin it rite?

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:9, topic:191558”]Is that all I have to do? Or do I have to transfer the CSS stuff over into the external file ____.css ?

I’m quite confused, I don’t even look at the code, I just make the page in dream weaver lol[/quote]
Yes, move everything inside the tags over to that file, then you can remove the style tags.
While WYSIWYG editing is fine for beginners such as yourself, your going to want to get into the code sooner or later.
.

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

ok am going to transfer the CSS over in a second.

  1. How do I make it so that in differen’t resolutions it looks the same?
  2. How do i make it centered?

Thanks so far guys!

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:9, topic:191558”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=255197.msg2126378#msg2126378 date=1206166710]

So how would i go about seperating the html from the css, as you said D D 3 I should do that?

edit - Also will my website look all right to people with different resolutions? Because I think the website might be fucked up if someone is on a different resolution.

Make a external file with the name “____.css”.

In the HTML header put:

[/quote]
Is that all I have to do? Or do I have to transfer the CSS stuff over into the external file ____.css ?

I’m quite confused, I don’t even look at the code, I just make the page in dream weaver lol[/quote]

Ya… You transfer the CSS you already have in your .HTML to the style.css, or whatever you named it.

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:6, topic:191558”]So how would i go about seperating the html from the css, as you said D D 3 I should do that?

edit - Also will my website look all right to people with different resolutions? Because I think the website might be fucked up if someone is on a different resolution.[/quote]

You are correct. It looks totally different with a much greater resolution. But when I minimize the browser a bit, it looks fine.

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @D_D_3 D D 3
item.description:
@D_D_3 wrote:

CSS:Cascading Style Sheets. Language used to describe how an HTML document should be formatted.

See the part

http://www.webdesign.org/web/html-and-css/tutorials/css-basic-css-codes.1335.html

That’s what css.It’s like the design of your site seperated from the html file.Like the colours and backround colours.

Read full topic

CSS is everything within the tags

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

thanks but not a lot of your post made sense to me.

What is CSS? I used the pen tool in photoshop to create the boxes… which probably isn’t a good idea.

And thanks, will look at the website you posted shortly.

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @D_D_3 D D 3
item.description:
@D_D_3 wrote:

It’s ok I see you used the pen tool?Anyways you should seperate the css from the html file.Html is basically easy you don’t need a tool you just the tool for editing graphic effects.

[code]

SexyDave.co.uk

22 march 08
- Just began learning how to create websites. I know this website won't be popular but I thought I'd make it for good practice.

 

 

[/code]

And you need to make your writing fit into your box.Just learn basic html codes then get further up.Btw here is a helpful site it helped me with the basics scroll down for all the codes like inserting a image and text. http://www.web-source.net/html_codes_chart.htm

GL

Read full topic
